attributes.action: No to Penalty fares and yes to good customer services on Britain's railways.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are links to news article about this issue.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-31149024 
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2015/feb/07/rail-fares-guilty-innocent-train-companies
If you agree that travelers who are willing to buy tickets should be able to buy tickets on the train please sign the petition ans share it around
attributes.background: Train users are being treated as guilty until proven innocent by fare enforcement officers and sometimes fine people even when it is not possible to buy a ticket before boarding. Passengers who are willing to buy a ticket on the train they should be able to buy tickets on the train.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to require train companies, as part of their franchise agreements, to allow passengers to buy tickets on trains.
